intro: Pelea punctata, commonly known as the punctate pelea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly rough texture. Pelea punctata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
